The TzHaar-Xil is an inhabitant of the TzHaar city. They can be found wielding three Toktz-Xil-Ak, a set of Toktz-Xil-Ul (which they use in both melee or ranged style), or a Toktz-Xil-Ek. TzHaar-Xil are the second strongest race in TzHaar, excluding some TzHaar Fight Cave monsters. The meleers can conveniently be ranged or maged from safespots around the various sulphur vents and fissures in the cave, though this is harder due to the fact that they are spread out more and the lack of safespots.

The TzHaar-Xil wielding the Toktz-Xil-Ul will stop attacking for one turn when switching between ranged and melee attack styles. Players using protection prayers should bear this in mind when fighting them. They are weak against slashing weapons, so a Chaotic longsword, godsword, or abyssal whip will prove helpful in defeating them.

It is not advised to use Magic to fight TzHaar-Xil as they seem to have an extremely high magic resistance.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 13,091 samples from the Drop Log Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average TzHaar-Xil kill is worth 2,571 coins.

These items are dropped alongside main drops.

  • TzHaar-Xil concept art.

Achievements[edit | edit source]

  • Jungle Predator ( 0) – Obtained a collection of unique drops from Slayer monsters located within Karamja.
    • Toktz-xil-ul, Toktz-xil-ak, Toktz-xil-ek, TzHaar-Ket-Om, Toktz-ket-xil, obsidian cape, and ring of stone drops

  • TzHaar-Xil after 19 September 2005 (update)

  • TzHaar-Xil after 13 May 2008 (update)

  • TzHaar-Xil after 14 February 2012 (update)

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • update 19 September 2005 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • TzHaar-Xil used to be around most of the old TzHaar city, but they were spread further apart after the graphical update.
  • Sometimes a TzHaar-Xil will attack using a weapon that it doesn't appear to have equipped, or using an attack style not possible with the weapons it does have equipped.
  • One of the TzHaar-Xil in the TzHaar City is glitched. It will only do melee attacks despite having a Toktz-Xil-Ul.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Mod Shauny. TokHaar-Hok. 8 October 2019. (Archived from the original on 10 June 2020.) "Rarity = 1/5000. 1/4850 if you have tier 2+ Luck active."
